msg: I was asked to share links from my brief talk in NYC about the Internet Society's Collaborative Governance Project. First I mentioned the IETF's consensus method of humming. This is codified in RFC7282 https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7282 - Ithen played the video of Larry Strickling's 'call to mulistakeholder action' at the EuroDIG last week https://youtu.be/_z7w67rsZOA - lastly the link to the Collaborative Governance Project i
https://www.internetsociety.org/collaborativegovernance/
slackbot1's url (2/2): [Larry Strickling keynote at EuroDig 2018 - YouTube]
slackbot1's url (1/2): [RFC 7282 - On Consensus and Humming in the IETF]
slackbot1's url: [Collaborative Governance | Internet Society]

Thank you for the timely call to action. The “Why the Multistakeholder approach works”, one of the documents linked from the CGP, has been translated as https://medium.com/@vincent.wschen/%E7%B6%B2%E8%B7%AF%E6%B2%BB%E7%90%86-%E7%82%BA%E4%BB%80%E9%BA%BC%E5%A4%9A%E6%96%B9%E5%88%A9%E5%AE%B3%E9%97%9C%E4%BF%82%E4%BA%BA-multistakeholder-approach-%E7%9A%84%E6%96%B9%E6%B3%95%E6%9C%89%E6%95%88-4c689d34ca85 and is circulated within the PO
